description: Learned borrowing from Ancient Greek Γιγαντομαχία (Gigantomakhía), from Γίγας (Gígas, “giant”) + μάχη (mákhē, “battle”) + -ια (-ia). Compare Titanomachy, Typhonomachy, centauromachy.

entries.meaning: (Greek mythology) The battle of the Giants (offspring of Gaia, according to Hesiod conceived from the spilt blood of Uranus) against the Olympian gods.
examples: Here we will examine Amazonomachies, Gigantomachies, and Centauromachies; the Trojan War will be discussed in Chapter 7.

entries.meaning: (by extension) Any battle envisaged as being waged by giants against gods or against an established universal order.
examples: Giant and dragon interchange as opponents of god or hero in folklore; in the gigantomachies we have evidence of their near-identity.
